description: Mobile techniques used by eSurv, ATT&CK software S0507 (v1.1)
name: eSurv (S0507)

techniques.comment: [eSurv](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0507) can exfiltrate device pictures.(Citation: Lookout eSurv)

[eSurv](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0507)’s Android version is distributed in three stages: the dropper, the second stage payload, and the third stage payload which is [Exodus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0405).(Citation: Lookout eSurv)
[eSurv](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0507)’s Android version has used public key encryption for C2 communication.(Citation: Lookout eSurv)
[eSurv](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0507)’s Android version has used certificate pinning for C2 communication.(Citation: Lookout eSurv)
[eSurv](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0507) imposes geo-restrictions when delivering the second stage.(Citation: Lookout eSurv)
[eSurv](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0507) has exfiltrated data using HTTP PUT requests.(Citation: Lookout eSurv)
[eSurv](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0507) can track the device’s location.(Citation: Lookout eSurv)
[eSurv](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0507) can exfiltrate the device’s contact list.(Citation: Lookout eSurv)
[eSurv](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0507)’s iOS version can collect device information.(Citation: Lookout eSurv)
